meanings.definition: Sensory receptors that respond to mechanical pressure or distortion.
meanings.sent1: The mechanoreceptors in my skin help me feel when someone touches me.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study mechanoreceptors to understand how our sense of touch works.
meanings.sent3: The mechanoreceptors in the robot's fingers made it very sensitive to touch.
meanings.sent4: Her mechanoreceptors were like tiny detectives, always detecting any movement around her.
meanings.sent5: The mechanoreceptors in the flower petals could sense even the gentlest breeze.

meanings.definition: Cells that convert mechanical stimuli into electrical signals.
meanings.sent1: The mechanoreceptors in the ear help us hear by converting sound vibrations into signals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching how mechanoreceptors in the skin can help in developing new technologies.
meanings.sent3: The mechanoreceptors in the phone screen were so sensitive, they could detect even the lightest touch.
meanings.sent4: His mechanoreceptors were like tiny messengers, carrying important information to the brain.
meanings.sent5: The mechanoreceptors in the robot's hand were crucial for its ability to grasp objects securely.

meanings.definition: Organs that detect physical stimuli and transmit information to the brain.
meanings.sent1: The mechanoreceptors in the eye help us see by detecting light and colors.
meanings.sent2: Doctors rely on mechanoreceptors to understand how our body responds to different stimuli.
meanings.sent3: The mechanoreceptors in the plant's roots were like its own communication system with the soil.
meanings.sent4: Her mechanoreceptors acted like messengers, sending signals to the brain about the environment.
meanings.sent5: The mechanoreceptors in the skin were like tiny spies, always alerting the brain to any touch or pressure.
